channel.title: CVE Feed for Go standard library -- net/http/internal
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Go standard library -- net/http/internal

item.title: CVE-2023-39326|2023-12-06T16:27:53.832Z -- go%20standard%20library -- net%2Fhttp%2Finternal
item.description: A malicious HTTP sender can use chunk extensions to cause a receiver reading from a request or response body to read many more bytes from the network than are in the body. A malicious HTTP client can further exploit this to cause a server to automatically read a large amount of data (up to about 1GiB) when a handler fails to read the entire body of a request. Chunk extensions are a little-used HTTP feature which permit including additional metadata in a request or response body sent using the chunked encoding. The net/http chunked encoding reader discards this metadata. A sender can exploit this by inserting a large metadata segment with each byte transferred. The chunk reader now produces an error if the ratio of real body to encoded bytes grows too small.
